content.description:
Easier to Access Rappeling Down. 

Can TR it from the Bolt Anchor on the Upper Ledge

Start at the Rap Rings on a Slopy Grassy Ledge.

Slaby corner moves past 1 bolt lead to a cruxy roof. Pull the Roof, Clip a couple Bolts and do some stemming before an easier 2nd roof. Finish at the Big ledge with the Bolt Anchor.

A cool Pitch ! 

Might be soft for the grade.


3X(0.3) 2X(0.4-0.75) 1X(1-2), Small Offset Nuts are nice...

P1: 5.10c - 40m Fingers forever in a cool stem box move Right before the 2nd roof to a gear belay on a slopy ledge.

P2: 5.9 - 40m  Burly cracks to a cool headwall. Clip or Skip the Bed Frame Fixed Pin to a Bolt Anchor at the Top.



4X(0.3-0.4) 2X(0.5-1) 1X(2-3), Nuts


Climbers right from the lowest section of the Wall.

The Big Chemney hidden around the climber's right side of the upper half was the first route cleaned and sent on lead at the cliff.

Fun stemming over a small roof with good gear.

Standart Rack.


Standart Rack to 2

From The Upper Ledge, Climb the hand crack, over a Roof and through the chemney before clipping the Anchor.

A large amount of rocks was pried off the 2 pry me routes before and after the FA... 

Can set a TR from the Top.


Standart Rack

The Better Variation. When Possible, exit the corner to your left and climb broken cracks to the top.


Standart Rack

The best line up the wall yet. Start 5 meters right from the lowest point of the Cliff, Just left of Le Coin. P1: 5.8  Delicate Face climbing on small tricky gear leads over the arete to a nice ledge and gear Belay. P2: 5.10+ Finger splitters lead up to a blind move. More fingers lead the way to burly undercling and a Gear Belay on a small ledge. P3 5.11 (Could be split in 2 for better belaying of second) Move left around the corner and Jam up the near Horizontal roof crack, look back at the view and pull the lip!  Easy climbing lead up to a bolted anchor.  4-5X(0.3-0.4) 2X(0.5-1) 1X(2), nuts.
All gear anchors Take 0.3-0.5

The Faces is a 80 meters tall Prow of steep and roofy granite located 300m above Bennett Lake, Carcross, YT.

If you look at it from the right angle, multiple human faces can be seen in the features of the Cliff.

The climbing is steep, technical and physical with a feeling of alpine climbing.

Most of the routes start from the bottom of the cliff, offering 2 to 4 pitches climbs but one can TR the upper half and skip the mandatory gear anchor and some of the harder climbing.

It is North Facing very exposed to the wind making it quick to dry.

Some of the pitches offer some wild moves and exposed roofs with a truly breath taking back drop making a great destination for any confident 5.10 trad Climber.

DESCENT: A Bolted Rap Line is located at the top of the Pry Me climbs. 

RACK: (Using BD Camalot as reference) Its a lot of fingers...

Single to 3 / Double .75-1 / Triple or Quadruple 0.3-0.5 / Double 0.2 / Nuts.
